Thankyou Brett and David, I have resolved it.

 

I put try, catch around the static initializer and found out it was a
null pointer exception.

I had a try, catch before but I was catching a specific exception -
ClassNotFoundException.

 

It was null because I am using a parallel package structure for my test
classes. In a method the static initializer calls, I add the package
name onto the class path. But because the class path now had two
classpaths separated with a semi colon, the full directory name was
invalid. 

I have resolved it by splitting the classpath around semicolons and
looping through each classpath.

 

Regards,

Chris
